text:
what are these functions called?
```struct cookies
   a
end
(x::cookies) = x.a * 100```

   a
end

text: Functors?

text: how would the syntax work in this case, to call this function?

text: Pedro these types of things are super nifty for making very concise code. Especially when a struct mostly serves a single purpose. Usually transforming an external value based on some stored state.

elements.text: Pedro these types of things are super nifty for making very concise code. Especially when a struct mostly serves a single purpose. Usually transforming an external value based on some stored state.

text: This is interesting, didn't know this syntax was possible.

text:
should't this be `(x::cookies)() = x.a * 100` ? In any case in most cases I find closures to be so much more idiomatic
```cookies(a) = ()->a*100```

elements.text: should't this be
(x::cookies)() = x.a * 100
? In any case in most cases I find closures to be so much more idiomatic
cookies(a) = ()->a*100
